SEG.ORIGINAL_TEXT: Attaque à Charlie Hebdo – onze morts
Dix morts selon le parquet de Paris .. La police évoque “un carnage, une boucherie” ….
This is how freedom of speech obviously is getting understood by some. I am very sorry for the victims – in the meantime 11 people – and their families.
I was just watching the news report – very worrying.

For those who aren’t familiar with Charlie Hebdo, it’s a French satirical magazine similar to the UK’s Private Eye. I’m sure most remember the furore caused throughout the muslim world when they published a cartoon of the Profit Mohamad in 2011, after which their office was destroyed by petrol bombs.
’tis a bit scary to think that two men carrying Kalashnikovs are walking around Paris.
Awful and just so very, very sad, apparently 12 people killed including two police officers. Reports say 2 of their illustrators are among the victims.
12 now dead, 5 also critical .. and the murderers are still on the loose in East Paris!
An attempt to halt freedom of speech in a democratic world.

Horrendous..have been watching the news reports, what a horrific loss of some brilliant people…so sad for their families/friends/colleagues and for France. Was there a warning for the police to be on the scene?
It’s very worrying – one report said the attack was carried out with military precision. And the perpetrators are still at large!
I should imagine some tabacs will be removing the magazine from their shelves out of fear.

Ian Hislop may well be looking over his shoulder – all in the name of religion <img src="http://www.frenchentree.com/wp-content/plugins/classic-smilies/img/icon_cry.gif.pagespeed.ce.XaXwft5XMO.gif" alt=":cry:" pagespeed_url_hash="425741669"> (allegedly!!) Frightening!!!

This is just awful ………I feel very sad for the victims and their relatives and colleagues at this time. I was just watching the reports on French tv, English TV and France 24 – as was being said, it looks like a well planned attack, and not just a random act – which is even more worrying !
I hope the French security services can track down the source of the weapons but these people seem to be very clever unfortunately. No one must give in to them
Vile, vile, vile; anyone subscribing to this foul religion should consider the words in their book; ‘In the name of God, the Compassionate, the Merciful’.
Among the dead is Jean Cabut, AKA Cabu the cartoonist of Le Canard Enchainé which some Brits may know. He was a genius and the loss of his cartoons will be sorely missed.
These fanatics won’t rest until they have over run the world and got us all face down on the floor.

I object to the Daily Mail (and probably other papers) referring to these people “executing” their victims; they murdered them! Using the word execute lends a spurious air of legitimacy to their foul acts.
All is explained in the final sentence:
“Arab League chief Nabil al-Arabi strongly condemns the terrorist attack on Charlie Hebdo newspaper in Paris,” the Arab League said
Al-Azhar condemned the “criminal attack,” saying that “Islam denounces any violence”, in remarks carried by Egypt’s state news agency MENA.

In a separate statement to AFP, Al-Azhar senior official Abbas Shoman said the institution “does not approve of using violence even if it was in response to an offence committed against sacred Muslim sentiments”.

Steve Bell tells BBC News channel: “We’ve got to stand up for the right to take the piss out of these monsters, these idiots, these fools, these posturing maniacs who strut around in their black gear as a kind of death cult trying to frighten us all.”
